docs.lead_paragraph: cream sandwiches and a lot of cuddling by mothers - it could have been a child's birthday party. But children's birthdays are not celebrated at the women's unit of the Westchester County Jail here. What was going on last week was Sesame Day, a new program designed to bring inmates and their children together once a month. The name Sesame Day comes from the television's ''Sesame Street.'' Its producer, the Children's Television Workshop, has donated supplies and games to the prison program as well as five-foot-high cutouts of the ''Sesame Street'' character Big Bird that were hanging from the ceiling in the jail's basement room.

headline.main: A MOTHER AND CHILD REUNION IN THE COUNTY JAIL
